text: A strange ROARING sound...

...in darkness. Light begins to spill on her from the rig - revealing her face, lost in thought. This is RACHEL SINGER - pretty, painfully young looking. A surgical dressing covers half her face. As we pull back a little we see that two YOUNG MEN sit either side of her. They are STEPHAN GOLD (thirties) thic set, capable, and DAVID PERETZ (late twenties), dark-hair and pale-faced. The three faces in the darkness, each looking straight ahead - something from a Caravaggio painting. The roaring, which we realise is the sound of ENGINES, gradually runs down into silence. The light from the bay door which is opening off-screen begins to flood the scene with HARSH DAYLIGHT, revealing the inside of a CARGO PLANE. Stephan turns to look at the growing light. Then he turns to Rachel.

Breathe. He stands. Rachel turns to look at David but he is standi too, his face a mask. Rachel gathers herself, then stands and turns to follow t other two, walking towards the light. As the three approach the opening and descend the ramp of the bay door, we hear a woman's voice:
We should never forget how young they were.
...as they walk across the tarmac - first Stephan...

head_text.subj: FINAL SHOOTING SCRIPT WITH PINK AMENDMENTS

text: My father, Stephan Gold, was the youngest Unit Commander in Mossad. David is next...
David Peretz had his twenty-ninth birthday while on the mission. Then Rachel.
My mother was even younger. Only twenty-five.
Silhouetted against the bright light is a group of waitin MILITARY and MOSSAD DIGNITARIES. Their hands are raised i applause.

Despite their youth they'd had the courage to confront an unimaginable evil.... The three walk towards their welcoming party. Rachel blin against the sunlight, takes out a pair of sunglasses and slips them on.

location: FUNCTION ROOM. HOTEL NEAR TEL AVIV

text: ...now 56. Handsome, impeccably groomed. A long crooked SCAR runs down one side of her face.

...a man whose sadistic experiments left thousands disfigured or dead, who became known by a name which defiles the annals of medicine: The Surgeon of Birkenau. She's wearing tinted glasses, staring at us, listening to Sarah speak.

head_text.subj: FINAL SHOOTING SCRIPT WITH PINK AMENDMENTS

text: Rachel's daughter - SARAH - stands at a podium, reading t Dedication to a rather large audience who have come for t launch of her first book. She's 31, and clearly her mother's daughter. The cover image from the book is projected on a screen behind Sarah - a black and white photograph of a young Rachel, David and Stephan. Above their faces, the title - In Our Hands.
Their mission had been to return him to Israel to stand trial. Instead it ended with his death on the streets of East Berlin...
...as she waits behind David and Stephan, face bleached o by the sunlight. She stares at the ground.

But this was not what was celebrated. It was their youth itself that became a symbol. Here were the children who had faced Israel's greatest nightmare, her greatest pain... David and Stephan have moved out of shot and Rachel reach the DIGNITARIES. Still looking down, she manages a smile, bob of her head, reaches out to shake the first hand...

head_text.subj: INT. FUNCTION ROOM. HOTEL NEAR TEL AVIV. DAY

text: ...lost in the memory.
...and in the simple act of facing the Monster, had helped to vanquish it. Sarah, has finished reading and looks for her mother in t audience...

head_text.subj: FINAL SHOOTING SCRIPT WITH PINK AMENDMENTS

text: This book is dedicated to my inspiration. My mother, Rachel Singer. People around Rachel begin to applaud, the sound almost startling her. Automatically she gives the same bob of th head, acknowledging the applause. Sarah, cheeks burning with a mixture of embarrassment and emotion, hasn't finished yet. She locks eyes with her mother.
Mother, I'm so very proud to be your daughter. More applause. Rachel manages to smile.

location: FUNCTION ROOM. HOTEL NEAR TEL AVIV

text: The room is now alive with the excited chatter of the guests. Rachel moves against the tide of the audience with a fixe social smile, murmuring thanks to well-wishers, trying to get out, trying not to look like she's trying to get out.

location: TEL AVIV. HOTEL NEAR TEL AVIV. PATIO

text: She emerges onto the empty patio, slides the glass door shut behind her, muffling the chatter from the room beyon She lights a cigarette, inhales greedily, trying to calm down. She stares at the sun blazing over the Mediterranea ahead of her. Her glasses darken against the reflected glare. As if sensing something she turns to see a SMALL BOY - he GRANDSON - watching her from behind the glass of the pati door, something UNNERVING in his direct gaze. Rachel stares back at him in silence. Sarah appears behind the boy, her son, and scoops him up into a hug. Still the boy stares at his grandmother, who gives a tight smile and turns back to the sea. Another guest walks up to Sarah and she nods, smiling, at what he is saying to her but her eyes slide back to her mother, standing on the other side of the glass.

head_text.subj: FINAL SHOOTING SCRIPT WITH PINK AMENDMENTS

text: A shabby, dimly-lit stairwell in a run-down section of th city. A YOUNG MOSSAD AGENT knocks at one of the apartment doors After a moment it is answered by OLDER DAVID, now 62.
David Peretz?
Yes.
You were expecting me? David looks at this young version of himself.
Yes. I was expecting you.

Would you come with me sir? David stares at him, then walks back into the apartment. The door almost swings shut and the Agent catches it, considering walking in after him. But before he can, Davi re-emerges carrying his jacket.
Let's go.

We TRACK with David, CLOSE on his face as the two men beg the long walk down the staircase. He doesn't say anything to his companion, doesn't look around him, and we HOLD on that face as his mind tries to catch up, tries to work something out, to decide...

The apartment block stands on stilts. Abandoned furniture is piled around the columns supporting the building. Still on David as the two men walk out from the darkness into the street that services the run-down estate. David follows as the agent moves ahead towards a larger road.

head_text.subj: FINAL SHOOTING SCRIPT WITH PINK AMENDMENTS

text: They cross a busy carriageway, and wait for a moment on t central reservation for a break in the traffic. Parked on the far side of the road, two identical cars, their windows tinted. The Agent moves to the leading car, opens the driver's do and gets in. David stops in the road, opens the rear passenger door and throws his jacket inside. He pauses for a moment and turns to look back at the seco car.
A MAN sits in the back of the car, silhouetted against th brightness outside. This is OLDER Stephan, now 63. He watches as David straightens up, hands on hips, squinting up at the sun.
(Indistinctly)
Sorry. The Agent turns.
What, sir?
(Beat)

I - I think I... He stands like that for a moment and then suddenly STEPS OUT INTO THE ROAD in front of an on-coming TRUCK. The impact sweeps him out of the frame. The shocked Agent scrambles out of the vehicle as other cars screech to a halt in front of David's lifeless body. TITLES END.
A celebratory dinner for the book launch is in progress - publishers, journalists, local dignitaries...

head_text.subj: FINAL SHOOTING SCRIPT WITH PINK AMENDMENTS

text: Rachel is re-joining the table, taking her place beside h daughter amidst the dinner party chatter. Sarah watches her. SARAH
When are you going to stop? RACHEL
Stop what? SARAH
The smoking. RACHEL
Soon. SARAH
I hope so. Do it for your grandson. SARAH
Are you sure you have to go back home tomorrow? RACHEL
It's all arranged, I'm afraid... SARAH

But we'll have breakfast before you go? I thought maybe we could take a walk on the beach? (Trying to sound casual) I'd like you to see more of him. A WAITER leans over with WINE for Rachel. She covers her glass. RACHEL
(To Sarah, ill-at-ease) Well, I'll be back. We can...maybe in the holidays or... MIRIAM, a PUBLISHER appears at her shoulder with a copy o Sarah's book. MIRIAM
I've marked the place. I thought perhaps from chapter eleven...? RACHEL
...Yes, thank you. Rachel nods absently, flicking through the pages of the book. Sarah realizes, with a small stab of pain, that she has no idea what that means.

head_text.subj: FINAL SHOOTING SCRIPT WITH PINK AMENDMENTS

text: SARAH
If you'd rather read something else, mother..... RACHEL

No, that's fine. Rachel is barely listening. She is staring at a black and white photograph in the book. We see that the photograph is of a YOUNG MAN in NAZI UNIFORM. It's titled: DIETER VOGEL, "The Surgeon of Birkenau." MIRIAM
You must be very proud. Rachel looks up at her, realizes what Miriam is talking about. RACHEL
(A little automatic) ...It's a wonderful achievement. I'm very proud of her. MIRIAM
And I'm sure you were invaluable in the research. SARAH

(Keeping it light) Actually, my mother withstood all interrogation. My father was the talker. (Trying a joke) I'm the only journalist in Israel she won't speak to. Miriam laughs obligingly but Sarah instantly regrets the remark. There is a sudden excited MURMUR from the table. The wome look over to where Stephan approaches the table. He is in motorised WHEELCHAIR. The Mossad Agent attends discreetly in the background. Rachel's face hardens. RACHEL
I thought he couldn't come. SARAH
(Standing up, surprised) So did I. Several of the local POLITICOS have stood up to greet Stephan, who is all smiles and handshakes.

head_text.subj: FINAL SHOOTING SCRIPT WITH PINK AMENDMENTS

text: STEPHAN
(To the politicos) Please, sit, sit. My God, it must be election season. There's good-natured laughter from the table. Sarah joins her father, kissing his cheek. SARAH
You came. STEPHAN

I came. So you're the famous author I've heard so much about? Rachel watches as he takes a place at the table, picks up copy of the book and examines the cover photograph, holdi his glasses a little from his eyes to focus. STEPHAN (CONT'D)
(Without looking) Rachel. RACHEL
Stephan. STEPHAN
(To Sarah) Now you're the expert, maybe you could tell me something. (Pointing to himself) Who's this handsome devil on the cover? More polite laughter from the table. STEPHAN (CONT'D)
It went well? SARAH'S HUSBAND
She was wonderful. STEPHAN

That's good. Good, good. That's very good. Rachel takes a sip of water and notices Stephen's hands, crumbling some bread - they're SHAKING. She looks up at his face, reads the hidden STRAIN there. He senses her gaze and meets it, and for a second his smi falters and SOMETHING LIKE PANIC flickers in his eyes. Rachel stares back at him, disturbed. Miriam stands, tapping her glass with her fork.

head_text.subj: FINAL SHOOTING SCRIPT WITH PINK AMENDMENTS

text: I just want thank you all for coming to help us celebrate the launch of this wonderful book. I'm sure we're all particularly thrilled to have two of the heroes of this story at the table. And even more thrilled that one of them has agreed to read for us... Applause. She gestures to Rachel who stands, still lookin at Stephan. The table quietens down. Rachel opens the boo at the marked place and hesitates, only now realising wha she is about to read. Then...
(reading)

"On the evening of the 31st of December, it began to rain more heavily. So isolated had they become from the outside world that it was only when she looked out of the window that Rachel remembered it was New Year's Eve...

Young Rachel stands in the small kitchen. Rain lashes on the window. She stares out at some FIREWORKS exploding nearby, then turns away and begins to gather three METAL SAUCEPANS from the shelves. We TRACK with her as she walks into the...

And begins to place the pots on the floor to catch the rainwater which is dripping through various points in the ceiling. As she positions the last pot we REVOLVE around her to ge our first view of the far wall. And there, tied to a radiator, is DIETER VOGEL, now 50. He's bound, his mouth taped, apparently asleep. Rachel doesn't, of course, react to this sight. Instead she begins to clear away some pieces of BROKEN GLASS BOWL from the floor. We TRACK with her as she walks back down the short hallway into the kitchen, drops the pieces of bowl into the bin. From the living room comes the three distinct PINGS of rainwater dripping in the pots.

head_text.subj: FINAL SHOOTING SCRIPT WITH PINK AMENDMENTS

text: She stops suddenly, puzzled. It's a moment before she wor out what she's noticed - something has changed in the sou of the rainwater next door. There are only two drips instead of three. She walks back towards the living room... RACHEL'S P.O.V - through the living room door we can see that one of the pots has been overturned. Rachel slows to stop. A sudden wave of adrenalin causes her to turn but...it's too late. Vogel steps out of the alcove he's been standing in so that he is directly in front of her. Before she can even cry out he has slashed her face open with a SHARD OF GLASS. Instinctively she cups her hands to her ripped face. Voge grabs her by the hair and stepping behind her, tries to worm his other hand underneath her raised arms to reach h throat with the glass. Her training kicking in, Rachel uses a krav magah move to grab and twist Vogel's forearm, breaking his hold on her and turning the arm until, with a yell of pain, Vogel dro the shard. He swings wildly at her, but Rachel ducks the fist and drives the palm of her hand up into his face. Vogel stumbles back, surprised by her speed and the sudde pain of the blow. Rachel is about to press home the attack but is blinded b blood from her wound washing into her eyes. As she wipes her eyes clear, Vogel grabs a LAMP from a small chest of drawers in the hall and smashes it into he face. She falls. Vogel begins to run, but, driven by adrenaline and desperation, Rachel scrambles onto all fours and lunges a him, catching hold of his trouser leg as he moves towards the front door. Vogel stumbles, manages to pull a leg free and stamps dow on Rachel who lets go with a moan. He stamps again, steps free and kicks her hard in the head. Rachel rolls with the force of the kick and comes to a rest, losing consciousness. RACHEL'S P.O.V - LOW ANGLE - Fluttering in and out of darkness - Vogel's feet as he stands beside us, breathing hard. Then he turns and hurries to the front door...and out.

head_text.subj: FINAL SHOOTING SCRIPT WITH PINK AMENDMENTS

text: Vogel hurries along the walkway and sets off DOWN THE SPIRAL STAIRCASE of the apartment building. 16    INT. BERLIN SAFE HOUSE. NIGHT. Rachel lies motionless. Then a cough. And another. And finally she rolls over, holding her gaping cheek with one hand, and drags herself towards the CHEST OF DRAWERS.
Vogel runs down the spiral staircase.
With difficulty, Rachel pulls out a GUN fitted with a silencer... and pulls herself towards the door.
Vogel's dwindling figure as he nears the bottom of the stairs.

Streaming blood from her face, Rachel heaves herself out the apartment towards the railings guarding the walkway. hear the clatter of Vogel's feet on the stairs below. She raises the gun to the railings, to take aim....
Bursting from the stairwell, Vogel starts to run across t courtyard towards the street.
Rachel's aim follows Vogel's lunge for the gateway...
There is a lurid flash of fireworks from nearby and for a moment we see Vogel lit, about to make it to the gate and disappear forever...

head_text.subj: FINAL SHOOTING SCRIPT WITH PINK AMENDMENTS

text: Rachel FIRES. A single shot. And, improbably, incredibly, the tiny figure of Vogel drops. Rachel hangs over the banisters far above us, gun in hand staring at us with disbelief.

Rachel finishes reading and puts the book down. Nobody   moves. The air of bonhomie has been replaced by uneasy   silence. Not knowing what else to do, one of the guests   begins to clap and the others hurriedly join in. Rachel   doesn't acknowledge the applause. Stephan is staring at her with a STRANGE INTENSITY.

Stephan and Rachel sit in the back of the car. Behind a screen the young Mossad Agent we saw earlier sits in the front next to the Driver. Tel Aviv races by in neon smear The air is charged with tension.
(Of the driver) He's driving too fast.
Stephan ignores her. She turns to the window, watches as they streak past another car.
This is ridiculous. What's so important? Tell me where we're going?
We're going to David's apartment.
Rachel turns to him, startled.
David...?
I keep track of people Rachel. It's my job. (Beat) I know he came to see you yesterday.
(contemptuous) What's this? The jealous ex- husband or the intelligence officer?

head_text.subj: FINAL SHOOTING SCRIPT WITH PINK AMENDMENTS

text: A little of both. What did he want?
Fuck you.
What did he tell you? Something about his intensity unnerves her.

He didn't tell me anything. (Off his look) He didn't! He told me where he'd been travelling, that he'd been teaching... We spoke for a few minutes and then I had to go. Stephan is still staring at her, reading her.
(Bristling)
If you don't believe me ask him yourself. And then he can't keep it from his face - and she knows. Something terrible has happened.
Stephan sits in the middle of the squalid living room, lo in thought.

Rachel walks slowly though the room, taking it all in - t little islands of occupation, the places where David sat, read, slept. Piles of newspapers. Used cups. A mound of laundry... ON Rachel as she looks about her, looking for something, some sign from the man she knew. But there's nothing personal here. These are the rooms of a man who had no re home.
Rachel walks in and switches on the light. She stares around the dirty bathroom.

head_text.subj: FINAL SHOOTING SCRIPT WITH PINK AMENDMENTS

text: ...turning to face us, the beautiful smile...
...as she begins to cry.
Stephan sits listening to her breaking down.
Rachel sits on the couch.

Why did he do it? Stephan looks at her, considering. He takes out a sheet of PRINTED PAPER, hands it to her. S reads some of the first page, then looks up at him. And now we see it on her face too. Fear.
The Mossad Agent sits on the stairs, smoking. As the door behind him opens he stands aside and watches Rachel SWEEP past him down the stairs, without giving him glance.

Rachel is packing, folding clothes neatly, precisely, silently - all the time a terrible tension in her movements. She tries to close a drawer but it sticks, She keeps trying, then in a sudden rush of fury yanks the drawer fr and hurls it across the room. She stands breathing hard.

head_text.subj: FINAL SHOOTING SCRIPT WITH PINK AMENDMENTS

location: PATIO TERRACE/BEACH. HOTEL NEAR TEL AVIV

text: The next day. Tables under umbrellas are ranged along the terrace. Sarah and her husband are on the beach below, playing wit their son, laughing. As if feeling our gaze, she looks up at us, shielding her eyes against the sun.

Rachel sits at a table with Stephan, watching her daughte Stephan takes out an ENVELOPE and passes it to her. She opens it and examines the contents - an AIR-PLANE TICKET and TWO PASSPORTS. Stephan takes out a small BLACK CASE and slides it across the table towards her. She turns to look at it with disgust, KNOWING WHAT IT IS. Then she takes it and puts it in her handbag.
My car's waiting outside. It can take you to the airport. Rachel turns back to stare at her daughter.
Sarah, playing with her son, glances up once more at her mother on the patio.
Rachel stands, an elegant woman at breakfast, her dark glasses, her suit...She raises a hand and waves. Puzzled, Sarah waves back, then watches as her mother begins to walk away from her.
...as she walks from the bright light of the patio into t relative darkness of the hotel lobby, suitcase in hand, face set, steely.

head_text.subj: FINAL SHOOTING SCRIPT WITH PINK AMENDMENTS

text: We TRACK with her as she emerges from the shadow of the hotel back into the bright sunshine of the street and starts to walk along the sidewalk. After a moment a CAR purrs alongside. She ignores it for moment, keeps on walking, the car cruising beside her. Finally, almost angrily, she stops and gets in. The YOUNG AGENT sits in the back seat next to her. The car pulls smoothly away.

Rachel climbs from the car and walks towards the building pulling her wheeled suitcase. The young agent has climbed out and moves swiftly ahead o her, waiting as she passes into the departure building.

Rachel looks down at her passport. We see her PHOTOGRAPH and name - RACHEL SINGER. She hardly reacts as the agent ushers her to the front of the queue. An Officer takes her passport, and as he checks it, we see...
...the passport again. We're now looking at the black and white image of YOUNG RACHEL. The name beneath it is ELSA ROGET. The passport is slid back across the counter and we find ourselves in...
Rachel takes her passport back from the BORDER GUARD and walks forward, past the barrier into EAST GERMANY.

A CROWD of people are waiting beyond the check-point for their loved ones. They're all looking eagerly at us. Only one YOUNG MAN has his back to us, turning away to light a cigarette. Then he turns - Young David - a fine, sensitive face, darkly shadowed eyes. This is the SHOT we saw earlier. A moment when we see how anxious he is to play his part right. Then he smiles his beautiful smile...

head_text.subj: FINAL SHOOTING SCRIPT WITH PINK AMENDMENTS

text: Supered TITLES read "East Berlin, 1965." Rachel walks up to him and after a fractional hesitation they embrace.
(In German) How was your trip?
(German) Fine. Everyone sends their love.
You've cut your hair.
David takes her suitcase, and they begin to walk away, ha in hand, along the BERLIN WALL. Finally...
I'm David.
Rachel nods, embarrassed.
Rachel.
They have turned into another, quieter street. David lets go of her hand, and they walk on.
A figure leans over the railing on the crumbling balcony the top of the building, smoking a cigarette, watching. This is YOUNG STEPHAN.

David and Rachel are coming through the iron gate into th run-down looking courtyard. A MIDDLE-AGED WOMAN - the building's only other occupant watches the couple as the pass, David murmuring a greetin

head_text.subj: FINAL SHOOTING SCRIPT WITH PINK AMENDMENTS

text: A brief glimpse of the couple climbing the winding stairs a view we have seen before.

The place looks like a squat. YOUNG Stephan sits playing idly at a battered old upright piano, a cigarette in his mouth. He looks up as David and Rachel walk in and stand framed in the doorway, looking every inch the young married couple. Stephan looks at the for a beat, then starts to play the first few bars of Mendelssohn's wedding march. The other two blush furiously, not amused. Rachel takes h case from David.
Where do I sleep?
You're in my room. He waits just long enough to enjoy her reaction.
I'm moving in with him. (Beat) You're at the end there. She nods and walks off.

Stephan is smoking. David sits at the table. He is using file to create a notch at the bottom of a thin strip of sprung steel. Both men can hear the BATH RUNNING in the bathroom, both very aware of this new female presence in the house they' been sharing together for the last month.
What do you think of your new wife? David frowns at the steel strip, seeming preoccupied.
Too young. Stephan watches him, amused.

head_text.subj: FINAL SHOOTING SCRIPT WITH PINK AMENDMENTS

text: Pretty. David shrugs.
You didn't notice. He begins to sort his possessions out.
You know what I've noticed? You don't notice women. I've noticed that. How long have I known you?
(examining the steel)
I don't know.

Two years. All the places we've been to. You don't look at women. Before I get into that bed, is there anything you have to tell me? David sighs, blows on the steel strip and holds it up for Stephan to examine. We hear the bathroom door open and there is a quick glimp of Rachel wrapped in a towel as she slips past the door heading for her room. The two men watch her pass. Stephan turns and catches David's expression.
Well, well...I think he just noticed.

Rachel sits on her bed drying her hair. She stops, listening to the indistinct murmur of the men's voices fr the room next door. Rachel leans towards the wall, trying to hear more but the voices fall silent.
David, holding a kitchen knife, MOVES TO STAB Stephan. Stephan uses a krav magah move to disarm him. The knife clatters to the floor as he twists David's arm behind his back.

head_text.subj: FINAL SHOOTING SCRIPT WITH PINK AMENDMENTS

text: There's an element of showing off and Stephan uses a little more force than is necessary. David winces but doesn't say anything. Stephan turns to Rachel who has been watching.
Yes? Rachel nods and they change places. David picks up the knife and repeats the "attack" move on her. She disarms h easily. STEPHAN (CONT'D)

Now an attack from behind. David takes his position, grabbing Rachel from behind, bu he's so awkward with her the attack seems a little tentative. Stephan talks as Rachel practises breaking free from the hold. STEPHAN (CONT'D)
Where have you come from?
Argentina. STEPHAN
Really? Whereabouts?
Cordoba. STEPHAN
What were you doing there? RACHEL
My husband is an Industrial Chemist. Stephan glances at David, amused. STEPHAN
He does look like a chemist. David grabs Rachel again, once more holding back a little STEPHAN (CONT'D)
She's not going to fucking break, David. Move. He takes David's place. STEPHAN (CONT'D)
What were you doing before this?

head_text.subj: FINAL SHOOTING SCRIPT WITH PINK AMENDMENTS

text: Before Argentina we lived in Hungary where my husband studied... Stephan is smiling. She realizes he's talking about Mossa
Oh...Liaison.
And what did you do in Liaison?
(Beat)
Translator. Stephan looks even more amused.
So, first time in the field. Rachel feels herself blush a little angrily. Stephan grab her from behind and Rachel executes a perfect break, twisting Stephen's arm. Stephan winces, surprised.
Good. That's...good. David gives the slightest of smiles.
Welcome to Metsada.

Rachel lies in bed, restlessly playing with a locket arou her neck. Giving up on trying to sleep, Rachel rises from the bed, throws on a robe and pads out of the room... 51    INT. BERLIN SAFE HOUSE - LIVING ROOM. CONTINUOUS. ...and into the living room. She sits down at the table, stares at a FILE before her. She hesitates then opens it, forces herself to look at the terrible PHOTOGRAPHS inside a pile of severed legs, bodies covered in mustard gas wounds, phosphorus burns, a naked woman, barely a skeleto held up by two Nazi nurses, a row of DEAD BABIES, rulers laid beside them to indicate dimensions...

head_text.subj: FINAL SHOOTING SCRIPT WITH PINK AMENDMENTS

text: Rachel stares at this last image, overwhelmed.
David stands watching her through the half open door. He makes a small move - perhaps to go to her - then stops himself and slips back into the darkness.

A tram trundles down the wide Berlin street. Rachel and David are walking to Vogel's surgery, holding hands. She's pale, very frightened. David walks, trying, and failing, to think of anything to say to her. He suddenly notices an odd sound. It's Rachel, humming tunelessly to herself, very low. Something about this pierces him. He gives her hand a squeeze.
The two stand in the doorway, at the foot of the stairs leading into the clinic, their husband and wife routine.
(In German)
I'll be waiting for you. She nods, trying to smile.
(her throat is tight)

I won't...be long. They kiss. She turns to go, looking so young and lost... David hesitates, staring after her, then walks quickly away. Rachel walks up the steps towards the entrance. 55    INT. WAITING ROOM. DAY. A large NOTICE BOARD covered with photographs of grateful smiling MOTHERS holding their NEWBORN BABIES - row upon r of new life. Rachel sits staring at the board. She turns her attention to the frosted glass door to the doctor's surgery. Indistinct shadows move on the other side. She turns to look at the other two women sitting looking through magazines, then back to the door. A shadow darken as it approaches the glass, then the door opens and a NUR leans out.

head_text.subj: FINAL SHOOTING SCRIPT WITH PINK AMENDMENTS

text: (All dialogue at the clinic is in German, subtitled.)

Frau Roget? With a smile, the Nurse gestures for Rachel to enter. 56    INT. EXAMINATION ROOM. DAY. Rachel stands behind a SCREEN, trying to control her nerves. All we can hear is the sound of RUNNING WATER and Rachel's tense breathing. Finally she takes off her skirt and unbuttons her blouse with trembling fingers. She puts on the gown, and slips out of her underpants, stumbling a she steps out of them. We TRACK with her as she walks out from behind the screen into the large brightly lit room. She walks towards the GYNAECOLOGICAL CHAIR at the centre of the room. On the fa wall, behind a screen, someone stands washing their hands at a basin. As she walks, Rachel passes a tray of MEDICAL INSTRUMENTS her glance lingering on it. She reaches the chair and climbs onto it. A pause and the tentatively, she lifts her feet into the stirrups, tuggin the gown to cover herself as best she can. She tries to steady her breathing, focussing on the ceiling. A bright LIGHT shines down on her. We hear footsteps approach. Rachel closes her eyes.
Good morning, Frau Roget. I'm Doctor Bernhardt. Rachel opens her eyes. Vogel is sitting on a small stool, taking a speculum from the tray of instruments, his back us.
Good morning, doctor. He turns and smiles at us - and he has a wonderful, warm smile, the air of a gruff but kindly Uncle.
Alright now, just relax. We're going to do a little examination. If you feel at all uncomfortable, you just say. Alright?

head_text.subj: FINAL SHOOTING SCRIPT WITH PINK AMENDMENTS

text: She manages to nod. VOGEL (CONT'D)

Alright, this is my hand... and this is the speculum. It's going to feel cold. Rachel reacts as Vogel pushes the speculum into place, opens it and begins the examination. She stares up into t light. VOGEL (CONT'D)
Can I ask how old you are? RACHEL
Twenty five. VOGEL
And how long have you and your husband been trying for a baby? RACHEL
Nearly two years. VOGEL
Uhuh. Well, the ovaries look fine. Alright, let's see... your cervix is slightly retroverted. Tilted backwards? Rachel raises her hand to her LOCKET NECKLACE and begins fiddle with it. RACHEL
Really? The angle from which we next see VOGEL, and the way the image of his face freezes in black and white, tells us clearly that this locket conceals a CAMERA DEVICE. VOGEL
Mmm. But that generally shouldn't affect fertility. RACHEL
Oh, good. VOGEL
You have a slight accent, Frau Roget. Where are you from? RACHEL
Argentina. We just moved here... A few months ago.

head_text.subj: FINAL SHOOTING SCRIPT WITH PINK AMENDMENTS

text: Whereabouts in Argentina? Buenos Aires? He looks up at her and Rachel instinctively moves her han away from the locket. She finds herself nodding. Vogel looks away again. Rachel bites down on a wave of panic.
Oh, Buenos Aires. Beautiful. I went once, when I was young. We went to the Opera house I remember. What's it called again? Rachel stares at the light. Beat.
Teatro Colon. He turns back to her, holding a swab, the warm smile.
That's right. Beautiful. This might sting a little, dear. Rachel winces.
I'm sorry. Now, there's a couple of tests we need to run, make sure there are no problems. Is that alright? Rachel nods. He pats her hand.
Brave girl.
Rachel walks out and finds David waiting, smoking. He tak her hand and they walk off without speaking.

The two turn the corner, out of sight of the clinic. Davi glances at her. She looks pale, shaken. He feels a wave o sudden tenderness for her, opens his mouth to say somethi then catches himself. CLOSE on their hands. After a moment David LETS GO. They walk on.

head_text.subj: FINAL SHOOTING SCRIPT WITH PINK AMENDMENTS

text: Stephan sits at a table. Rachel and David appear beside h and join him. There is an awkward silence for a moment. Stephan sips his coffee.
(in German)
So. Everything...?
(in German, abruptly)

Next appointment is on Wednesday. She looks at David but he is staring at the table. Like Stephan he is uncomfortable with the thought of what Rach has been through. She takes his hand. He looks up, surprised, searches her face... But then Rachel lets go and walks off towards the toilets David looks down at the SILVER LOCKET lying in his palm.

Stephan walks down the street. A SMARTLY DRESSED MAN walk towards him, absently jingling his CAR KEYS in his hand. As he nears Stephan, the man fumbles the keys and they drop. Stephan dips down to pick them up and hands them ba to the man with a smile.
Vielen dank!

Bitte sehr. The two continue on their way, and we follow the smartly dressed man, closing in on his hand, in which he now hold his keys AND THE LOCKET. We see him tuck it into his jacket pocket as he walks on.

The FOOTBRIDGE which crosses over a closed RAILWAY STATIO below. On either side of the bridge runs a barbed wire topped FENCE. A few PEDESTRIANS cross the bridge in the early evening gloom, intent on getting home.

head_text.subj: FINAL SHOOTING SCRIPT WITH PINK AMENDMENTS

text: David and Stephan appear, walking over the bridge towards us. David's eyes flick to the tracks ahead and below as a TRAIN begins to thunder by. Stephan begins to COUNT softly to himself as the train ru below his feet.
One, two, three, four, five, six...
It's a ghost station...
A hand-drawn plan of a RAILWAY STATION is on the table. David indicates the tracks on the plan.
West Berlin trains pass through East Berlin on this track, but don't stop.
Usually. He raises a lighter to the cigarette in his mouth.

As the train disappears into the gloom and Stephan slows light his cigarette. Beside him David's eyes flick to the STATION PLATFORM in between the tracks below, eerily lit the gathering dusk. DAVID'S P.O.V - several BORDER GUARDS patrol the abandone platform.

The station's guarded at all times... We're TRACKING PAST the entrance to stairs leading down from the bridge onto the platform below. We see it's been sealed off with a locked gate. Another BORDER GUARD stand on the stairs below, staring up at us as we pass...

head_text.subj: FINAL SHOOTING SCRIPT WITH PINK AMENDMENTS

text: David indicates the point on the plan.
...and the stairs to the platform are sealed off.

The two men have walked on past the mid-point of the bridge. David glances at the far track. DAVID'S P.O.V - the track runs along the far side of the platform. On the other side of the track is a barbed-wire topped WIRE FENCE.
Our train driver makes an unscheduled stop on the near track.
The last two carriages will be around...
Stephan indicates a point on the track.
...here. And they will be empty. Once that train has stopped, the guards won't be able to see this fence. And on the other side of the fence is...

The two men are at the top of the stairs on the other sid of the bridge now. Stephan glances to his right... STEPHEN'S P.O.V - TRACKING as we descend the stairs. We c see that on the other side of that high wire fence is a C PARK and a long, low building...

...a postal depot. We see that car park is lined with the yellow VANS of Deutsche Post. Several FEMALE POSTAL WORKERS in dark skir and white blouses stand around the car park on their breaks, smoking and chatting. As we watch one of the vans trundles out of the OPEN FACTORY GATE.

head_text.subj: FINAL SHOOTING SCRIPT WITH PINK AMENDMENTS

text: The vans come and go all day long.
David rolls up the plan.
We're just one more parcel. Once we're in West Berlin there'll be transport to Templehof airbase and a private charter. Stephan stubs out his cigarette.
That's the wrapping. Now all we need is the present. Rachel realises both men are looking at her.

Rachel runs the hem of a partially-made WHITE GARMENT through a SEWING MACHINE. She finishes and takes it over where Stephan stands waiting. It's unfinished, but a fair good approximation of a MEDIC'S WHITE COAT.
Try this on. Stephan puts it on. She tugs at the coat, straightens the unfinished collar, runs her hands down the front to smoot it out.
(re: the coat)
How does it feel?

head_text.subj: FINAL SHOOTING SCRIPT WITH PINK AMENDMENTS

text: (Flirting)
Nice. Rachel ignores this, begins to pin the cuff of one of the sleeves.
Here you are, Mossad agent, all those years of training, the highest levels of marksmanship and krav magah, first big mission...sewing. Rachel resists a smile, brandishes the pin.
Black belt in dressmaking. He holds up his hands in surrender.
I never argue with an armed woman.
Rachel and Stephan sit as David serves the dinner. Rachel examines her dish.
(Politely)
What is it?
(Beat)
It doesn't have a name. Stephan tastes his.
(Grimacing)
Shit. David lifts his spoon, blows on it.
(Solemn)
Now it does. They laugh a little, settle into eating. David stares at his bowl, deciding whether or not to say something. Finally...

head_text.subj: FINAL SHOOTING SCRIPT WITH PINK AMENDMENTS

text: It's my birthday. They look up at him in surprise.

Tinny music plays. The place is almost empty. In the back of the bar the thr sit in a corner drinking beer - just young people, laughing, a little drunk. They could be students. Rachel is reciting something from memory.
Uh, at ten - study the Mishnah, at fifteen - study the Talmud. By eighteen - stand under the wedding canopy...
We're too late for all of those. They laugh.
Uh...twenty. In your twenties you are to "pursue your life's goals."
(Flirtatious)
What are you pursuing Rachel? Rachel thinks about it, shrugs.
I don't know. I'm waiting to find out.
(smiles to himself)
Youth...
What about you, grandfather? Have you got a goal?
(Smiling)
Oh yes. We believe in goals in my family. We're very driven men. My father was Director of Collections by the time he was fifty.

head_text.subj: FINAL SHOOTING SCRIPT WITH PINK AMENDMENTS

text: RACHEL
So what's your goal? STEPHAN
Director of Collections by forty. They laugh. RACHEL
(To David) What about you David. What "life goal" are you pursuing? David smiles, stares at his drink. DAVID
This is it. Rachel laughs, looks around at their less than glamorous surroundings. RACHEL
This is it? This is all you want? David laughs. He would obviously rather change the subjec but Rachel is a little drunk, a little curious. RACHEL
Seriously, what do you want out of life? DAVID

(Beat, shrugs) I want this. I want to get Vogel. I want him to be put on trial and I want the world to watch so everyone knows what he did. I want them all to know the truth. He looks up at their faces, embarrassed at having darkene the atmosphere. DAVID
And...I want another drink. He gets up and walks off to the bar. Rachel stares after him. Stephan watches her. STEPHAN
Forget about it. RACHEL
Forget about what?

head_text.subj: FINAL SHOOTING SCRIPT WITH PINK AMENDMENTS

text: I've spent two years with him, and I don't know him. Nobody knows him. He's alone. Rachel thinks this over.
What about family? Stephan stares at her. She realises what this means.
All of them?
All of them. He looks over at David standing at the bar.
Maybe it's not always a blessing to survive.

A tram passes, revealing Stephan walking across the scrubby, desolate park, jingling car keys in his hand. Suddenly he drops them. He's about to pick them up when a man dips down and hands them back to him. We recognize the moment.
Vielen dank!

Bitte sehr. Stephan walks on. In his hand he is now holding a small METAL TUBE. 76A    INT. EXAMINATION ROOM. CLINIC - DAY. From Rachel's POV we are watching Vogel as he prepares hi instruments. She has come for her second examination.
This is my hand. This is the speculum.

head_text.subj: FINAL SHOOTING SCRIPT WITH PINK AMENDMENTS

text: Rachel flinches as she feels the speculum. VOGEL (CONT'D)
How did you find me?
(beat) What? VOGEL
Who told you about me? RACHEL
Who... told us? VOGEL
Were you referred by a doctor, or...? RACHEL
(trying to conceal her relief) Oh, Doctor Eisenberg. VOGEL
Ah-ha. How is the old Jew?
Very good. Vogel busies himself for a moment. VOGEL
Any history of infertility in your family Frau Roget?
No. VOGEL
Are your periods irregular? Rachel stares up at the light.
Yes. VOGEL
Yes. I think we've found the problem. Rachel stares at him - she didn't know there was a proble VOGEL (CONT'D)
It's very common. Your ovarian follicles...well, inside you're still immature. (MORE)

head_text.subj: FINAL SHOOTING SCRIPT WITH PINK AMENDMENTS

text: We need to help you with this. There's something we can use, a little injection. Do you want to proceed?

Rachel nods, dumbly. Vogel nods, turns back to his tray o instruments, begins preparing an injection. Vogel turns back to her with the HYPODERMIC NEEDLE. Instinctively Rachel stiffens. He injects her.
(As he works) How many brothers and sisters do you have?
(Stiff) None.
An only child?
Rachel nods. Vogel smiles, not unkindly.
And yet you say there's no family history of fertility problems?
(Beat) I lost my mother in the war.

Vogel stares at her. Then, to her dismay, he TAKES HER HAND, and pats it with such a sad, sympathetic look, that she feels her eyes prick with tears. Then he lets go and turns back to the examination.
Rachel comes out to find David waiting for her again. Onc more he takes her hand and they walk off.
As they turn into the quiet street, David lets go of her hand. Rachel stops. She looks shaken. David watches her.
Are you alright?
She nods. Suddenly Rachel takes his hand again. David stares straig ahead but he DOESN'T PULL FREE and they walk on like that

head_text.subj: FINAL SHOOTING SCRIPT WITH PINK AMENDMENTS

text: Rachel and David walk into the room and find Stephan waiting for them.
Identity is confirmed. We have a green light. Rachel and David stare at him.

We are looking at a yellow DEUTSCHE POST van. Stephan and David are walking towards it. Stephan stops by the van, shielding David as he drops the length of thin steel we saw him working on earlier, from his sleeve - an improvised SLIM JIM. With professional ea he slips the Jim between the window and the weather shiel In seconds he has the door open and the two climb in...

Rachel comes out of the bathroom in her nightclothes, wit her hair wet around her. She looks into the kitchen. Davi is sitting smoking. Rachel pauses in the doorway and then walks in. A small two bar electric fire provides the only light in the room. Rachel kneels down in front of it to d her hair. David looks at her as Rachel spreads her hair around her shoulders. She looks very beautiful. She starts to comb h hair. On impulse, Rachel HOLDS OUT the comb to David. David takes it. He starts to comb, pulling it slowly through her hair. Then stops. The atmosphere is suddenly charged.
It's a brave thing you're doing.
I'm not brave. I'm terrified.
But you're doing it anyway. Because you know how important it is.

head_text.subj: FINAL SHOOTING SCRIPT WITH PINK AMENDMENTS

text: Another stroke and then he stops again, stares at the com in his hand.
You're very brave.
(Beat)

David... Rachel turns round and stares at him, overcome with longing. She leans in to KISS HIM. For a moment David hesitates, but then it's as if something inside him close and he pulls back from Rachel, his face cold. Without a word he gets up and walks out. Rachel sits, crushed... 80    INT. LIVING ROOM. BERLIN SAFE HOUSE - LATER. Rachel, sits at the piano in her robe, picking out notes. She's been crying. Stephan stands watching her from the doorway, holding a drink - something slightly predatory about him. He crosses to her, sits down beside her and starts to mat her notes. They work out a nonsense tune between them.
David listens as they play.
Rachel picks up Stephen's drink and takes a sip.

It's whiskey. Defiantly Rachel drains the glass, grimaces a little. Stephan watches her. He continues to play, moving the melody up in octaves until his hand is beside hers, then covering hers. Rachel brushes him away. He puts his hand back and starts to caress her wrist.
You're so beautiful... He begins to kiss her neck. Rachel stares ahead, pretendi it isn't happening. Then she gives in, turning to him.

head_text.subj: FINAL SHOOTING SCRIPT WITH PINK AMENDMENTS

text: Rachel stands at the mirror, dressing in a DARK SKIRT and WHITE BLOUSE, trying to control all the emotions she is feeling. Behind her Stephan lies in the bed watching her. Neither speaks.

Rachel and David cross the courtyard to the gate. David holds it open for Rachel. As they turn into the street, David takes her hand. Both stare fixedly ahead, only too aware of what happened the night before.
Rachel is in the chair for what she knows will - whatever happens - be the last time.
Alright, this is my hand. And this is the speculum.
Okay. Vogel begins the exam. From beneath her GOWN Rachel slips HYPODERMIC NEEDLE.
You had intercourse last night?
(Tight)
Yes.
Good. You're at the most fertile stage of your cycle. This is very good timing. He turns to his tray of implements.
I think we are going to see results.

head_text.subj: FINAL SHOOTING SCRIPT WITH PINK AMENDMENTS

text: VOGEL (CONT'D)
All you have to do is have faith. Ask any of my patients. RACHEL

What about your patients in Birkenau...? Vogel looks up in shock. Rachel grabs a fistful of his hair and pulls his head to one side. With her other hand she jams the needle into th side of his neck, and begins to depress the syringe. Vogel gives a grunt of surprise, opens his mouth to speak but no sound comes. He grabs vaguely for Rachel's throat with one hand, struggles with the needle with his other, eyes dull with fury, fighting the drug racing through him Rachel fights to hold him, bucking on the chair, pinned beneath his weight, struggling for breath... Weakening, VOGEL manages to pull the needle free and it drops to the floor...

...which we see still contains some FLUID. A rope of spittle drools from Vogel's contorted mouth ont her face. Then his eyelids flutter and close and he collapses onto her. Rachel pulls his hand from her throat, gasps for air. Finally she pushes him to the ground. She leaps up and deliberately knocks the tray of medical instruments to th floor. RACHEL (CONT'D)
Help! The Nurse runs in, reacts at the sight of the prone VOGEL RACHEL (CONT'D)
He collapsed! NURSE
My God! What happened?! RACHEL
(overlapping) I don't know! I don't know! He just clutched his chest and collapsed! The Nurse grabs for the phone and dials.

head_text.subj: FINAL SHOOTING SCRIPT WITH PINK AMENDMENTS

text: (into the phone) I need an ambulance! Karl-Gustav- Strasse. The clinic. My husband has had a heart attack.
Rachel reacts to this revelation.
(Over phone) Your name please?
It's Frau Bernhardt, please, please hurry!
Stephan kneels in a recess of the building, by the open NETWORK JUNCTION BOX of the clinic. He's wearing HEADPHONES, alligator-clipped to two cables in the box.
(Over phones) The ambulance is already on the way, madam.
Stephan un-clips the phones and pockets them. He straightens up, closes the junction box and walks calmly away, through a gate in the wall, into the next courtyard
As Stephan races up some steps, along a balcony, and into the building...
with Stephan through the hallway, out of the door and ont the street....
An AMBULANCE, sirens wailing, starts out of the dispatch, and swings onto the street.

head_text.subj: FINAL SHOOTING SCRIPT WITH PINK AMENDMENTS

text: Stephan rounds the corner of the street and walks TOWARDS THE CLINIC. He checks his watch as he turns into an alley opposite the entrance.
Rachel finishing dressing, looks anxiously at the nurse a she crouches by her unconscious husband, monitoring his breathing.
The AMBULANCE speeds on.

Stephan pulls back some rusty doors. Parked in the small courtyard beyond is the van we saw before, now decorated with AMBULANCE DECALS and LIGHTS. David drives the car forward as Stephan climbs into the passenger side...
Rachel paces outside the door, looking down the corridor. The nurse wipes away a tear, tense and frightened.
(to no one in particular)
Oh god! Come on, come on! Hurry!
A SIREN approaches and Rachel moves to the door...
They're here. Stay with him. I'll go and get them... The nurse nods gratefully.

head_text.subj: FINAL SHOOTING SCRIPT WITH PINK AMENDMENTS

text: ...a vehicle pulling up. Whether it's the real ambulance the fake one, we're not sure. 98     INT. LOBBY. CLINIC - CONTINUOUS. Rachel runs past the concerned patients in the waiting ar to see... David and Stephan, coming up the stairs, holdin a stretcher.
Rachel leads them in. Stephan crouches down beside Vogel and takes his pulse.
We need to take him to the hospital. He and David open up the stretcher and transfer Vogel to with some efficiency.
Oh God!
He's going to be alright. Rachel and the nurse follow David and Stephan as they car the stretcher out through the waiting room.
We hear the siren of the real ambulance starting up not-s very-far-away down the street as David and Stephan push t stretcher towards the doors. The nurse follows, but David stops her.
I'm sorry, Madam, but you'll need to meet us at the hospital.
But... I want to travel with him.
Not possible I'm afraid. New regulations. We begin to register that the siren is growing louder wit every second.

head_text.subj: FINAL SHOOTING SCRIPT WITH PINK AMENDMENTS

text: As Stephan and David carry the stretcher down the stairs, Rachel takes the nurse's hand to detain her.
Don't worry, he's in good hands now. He's going to be fine.
Thank you...thank you.

You should get your things, go to the hospital to meet him. The Nurse nods tearfully, starts to back towards her office, watching as they disappear. 101    EXT. CLINIC - LATE AFTERNOON. David closes the rear door of the van and the two jump in and drive off as Rachel comes out of the building. She begins to walk briskly away. Behind her, the real ambulance is pulling up at the clinic. She doesn't turn back.
The DEUTSCHE POST VAN that David and Stephan stole earlie pulls out into the street. Behind it we catch a glimpse o the now abandoned ambulance. David quickly closes the gat and climbs in.
Stephan draws up alongside Rachel and she climbs in as th door is opened for her.
The winter evening is gathering outside. David and Rachel are in the back of the van. David has taken off the white coat. David checks his watch.
(Tense)
I know, I know. He accelerates. Rachel grabs hold of the back of the seat to avoid fallin She looks down at the stretcher - Vogel lies unconscious.

head_text.subj: FINAL SHOOTING SCRIPT WITH PINK AMENDMENTS

text: One of his hands jolts free and drops onto her foot. Gingerly she steps free.

The depot car park is dark - rows of postal vans parked u An eerie silence. Through the high fence behind the vans we can make out th tracks and dimly lit STATION PLATFORM beyond - GUARDS patrolling in the little pools of light. As we watch a POSTAL WORKER comes out of the depot and walks through the carpark and out of the gate, his shift finished.

We're watching the WORKER walk in front of us and leave t car park. In the dark of the back of the van, Rachel crouches, watching him leave. She turns back to where Stephan and David wait by the van doors, bolt cutters in their hands. On the floor of the van lies Vogel's unconscious form. They wait in absolute silence, listening to the fading footsteps of the worker. David checks his watch, holds up a single finger to Stephan. Moments later we hear the sound of an approachin TRAIN. Stephan raises a hand and counts them down - five, four, three, two, one... The two men open the van doors and run at a crouch to the base of the foot-bridge stanchion, as the train roars fro the darkness and begins to pass them, screening the two m from the GUARDS ON THE PLATFORM. Rachel closes the rear door behind them and runs along th line of the fence to the other end of the yard and crouch down by a junction box, screened from the platform, standing watch. She looks over to Stephen and David in the shadows of the bridge stanchion.

head_text.subj: FINAL SHOOTING SCRIPT WITH PINK AMENDMENTS

text: Again silence falls. Then faintly we hear another engine approach. Moments later another train begins to roar past Instantly the two men rise from the shadows and begin to CUT through the wire fence, working with fierce concentration.
(Softly) One, two, three, four, five, six...
Rachel checks the car park behind for workers.

The train is almost past. The two men work feverishly, snipping through the remaining links, working their way towards each other - forming a four foot long split in th fence. They sprint for the stanchion again...
(As he runs) Twenty, twenty one, twenty two...

As they dive for cover the last carriages of the train pass. A guard on the platform glances over but sees nothing but darkness and the vague outline of the postal vans beyond the fence. He continues walking down the platform.

Rachel holds her breath, but nothing disturbs the new silence. Along the fence she can just make out the two men crouche in the shadows. Stephan raises his hand in an OK, signalling they're ready. Rachel suddenly hears FOOTSTEPS echoing in the car park. Through the window of a van, she can see a POSTAL WORKER emerging from the depot and crossing the car park. As she watches he takes out a cigarette, starts to light but then stops. He is staring over at the footbridge, as he can faintly make out those dark shapes at the base... He takes a few steps forward, puzzled. A little closer an he might really see something...

head_text.subj: FINAL SHOOTING SCRIPT WITH PINK AMENDMENTS

text: Rachel looks to the PLATFORM - the two guards visible the are talking to each other, looking the other way. She takes her chance - moves up behind the parked vans...
..as he takes a few steps closer to where Stephan and Dav are crouched...
(calling) Do you have a light?
The man turns and takes in this pretty postal worker, who has emerged BEHIND HIM. He smiles and walks back towards her. He lights her cigarette, studies her face.
You new?
First shift. The girls said it was okay to come out for a smoke....
David and Stephan lie listening to the murmured conversation.
Yeah, it's okay. Are you working until midnight?
Yes.
After the late shift most of us go to the Vetter. Do you know it?
David checks his watch again, nods at Stephan. We hear another APPROACHING TRAIN.
...smiling, pretending to be listening to the Worker.

head_text.subj: FINAL SHOOTING SCRIPT WITH PINK AMENDMENTS

text: ...it's just on the corner. You should come along.
She glances through the fence and down the track to where the train's LIGHT can be seen approaching in the gloom. This is it.
The inert body of Vogel, lying on the floor. His hands, bound at the wrist, suddenly twitch involuntarily.
POV - the Border Guards on the platform. The driver begins to BRAKE.
The Border Guards watch in surprise as the train slows...

As it passes them, the train screens Stephan and David fr the platform. The two men rise and swiftly begin to cut t remaining section of fence. As the train comes to a halt the last carriages stop directly opposite them, empty and dark. They're almost there.
In the distance, at the head of the train, the driver can be seen stepping down and gesturing to the guards, pointi up ahead.
There's something on the tracks up here!
The Guards peer doubtfully into the gloom ahead. One sets off to investigate.

head_text.subj: FINAL SHOOTING SCRIPT WITH PINK AMENDMENTS

text: ...getting rid of the Worker.
Well, maybe I'll see you there? I finish in half an hour. Why don't you go and get me a drink ready?
The Worker can't believe his luck.
Half an hour then.
He starts to move towards the gate... Suddenly the VAN HORN BLARES, shattering the silence of t car park.
Stephan and David turn back to the van.
She turns, shocked. The Worker too turns back in surprise

Vogel, hands still tied has wormed his way over the seats and is pressing frantically on the HORN. He claws at the tape over his mouth, manages to pull it free. Stephan leaps into the van and is upon him in seconds. Vogel manages to give a HOARSE YELL, then Stephan uses a krav magah move to silence him.
The remaining Border Guard is staring over at the darkene car park, trying to work out what he just heard.
What was that...?

head_text.subj: FINAL SHOOTING SCRIPT WITH PINK AMENDMENTS

text: David watches in dismay as a Guard comes into view at the far end of the platform, entering a GUARD HUT. He lifts a TELEPHONE inside.
(Softly) Fuck.
He heads for the van at a crouching run.
Rachel indicates the vans closest to them.
I think it came from over here?
No, it was one of those...
He steps past her, peering at the shadowy vans ahead. Rachel stares at him wondering if she can take him down silently.
Stay where you are!
She turns to see two BORDER GUARDS approaching the side gate of the car park.
...as the Border Guard comes back from checking the lines ahead.
There's nothing there. Get moving now!
His part of the mission completed, the Driver climbs back into his cab.
...as one of the Guards approaches her, pistol drawn. The second guard fans past, walking slowly towards the bridge The first guard SHINES A TORCH into Rachel's face.

head_text.subj: FINAL SHOOTING SCRIPT WITH PINK AMENDMENTS

text: What are you doing here?
I work here. I'm on a break.
Show me your papers, both of you.
The Worker nervously fumbles for his papers, passes them the Guard who inspects them.
David watches Rachel offer her papers to the Guard as the train starts to rumble back into life. He moves back towards the van.
(hissing) We have to go!
David stares over at Rachel. Stephan grabs Vogel.
We can make it. Help me with him...
(Handing them back) You can go.
The Worker gratefully hurries away. Rachel is watching tensely as the Second Guard closes on the van...
Stephan watches the train pulling away, THEIR LAST CHANCE He has pulled Vogel's body to the door.
(Hissing) We're going! Now!

head_text.subj: FINAL SHOOTING SCRIPT WITH PINK AMENDMENTS

text: David shakes his head.
Not without her.
He moves up the blind side of the van...
The Second Guard takes a few more steps and stops in surprise- the OPENING in the fence VISIBLE NOW.
(Startled) Hey! Over here!
David appears behind him and downs him, fast. A Guard on the platform has turned to see the opening in the fence, and yells out.

As the Guard beside her turns his attention to his comrad Rachel grabs the guard's gun hand, sweeping it away from her, at the same time stepping in close and punching the guard's throat with her other hand. As he staggers back choking, she twists the gun free.
Another guard hits an ALARM. A SIREN begins to sound...

About to head back to the van. A shot rings out and a BULLET suddenly strikes the ground beside her. She looks to see a GUARD has appeared up on the bridge, rifle aimed at her. Other Guards open FIRE, jumping down onto the tracks and advancing towards the cut fence. Acting on instinct, Rachel returns fire with the pistol, and takes cover behind the wall...

head_text.subj: FINAL SHOOTING SCRIPT WITH PINK AMENDMENTS

text: Stephan has jumped into the driver's seat and starts the engine. David scrambles into the back, barely making it before Stephan is peeling out, the back door hanging open...
...as more guards appear at the side-gate behind her - she's caught between them now. She watches in dismay as the van heads for the exit. Suddenly it brakes...
Stephan throws the gear into reverse..

and the van begins to reverse with a scream of tyres towards Rachel. The Guards at the side-gate open fire on the van hurtling towards them, bullets pocking the rear doors. The side door is flung open and Rachel dives in, just as Stephan roars forward again.
The Guard from the bridge has run down the stairs and is now between us and the exit. As we watch he raises his rifle...
Down!
The three duck as the Guard fires, punching a neat hole i the windscreen. Seconds later the van thuds into him, sending him flying.

head_text.subj: FINAL SHOOTING SCRIPT WITH PINK AMENDMENTS

text: ...as it roars out of the depot gates, bullets flying pas it...

On the road ahead a Border Guard Jeep appears, driving directly towards them. Stephan has no choice - he floors it. At the last second the jeep tries to pull right but the v catches its rear side and barrels straight through, the jeep spinning off and smashing into the wall.
Stephan fights to keep the van under control, screeches into a turn and off down the road.
Is he dead? (Beat) Is he dead?
Who?
The Guard! The one who saw your face! Is he dead?
No.
Stephen's grim silence says everything. He glances back a the unconscious Vogel lying between the other two.
How did he come round? How the fuck did he come round? You gave him the full injection?
Rachel hesitates.
Did you give him the...
I don't know! I thought I...

head_text.subj: FINAL SHOOTING SCRIPT WITH PINK AMENDMENTS

text: Jesus Christ! Stephan can't believe it's all fallen apart so quickly.
We could have gone!
It's not over.
We could have fucking...!
We still have him. Stephan glares at David but doesn't say anything. The van roars on.
Rachel sits on the floor looking towards the living room, staring at something.

...three POTS have been placed under drips from the ceili inside the room. We hear the three distinct notes of the water drops. Rachel stares dully at the water dripping, feeling exhausted and numb. A key scrapes and Rachel turns to the door as Stephan and David walk in, hair soaked from the rain.
(Standing up)
What did he say? Stephan stalks past, ignoring her.
You made contact? David nods. David looks after Stephan who's walked on int the living room in grim silence.
What did he say?

head_text.subj: FINAL SHOOTING SCRIPT WITH PINK AMENDMENTS

text: It's going to take time. They need to open up a new route, they need to find political help. Maybe the Americans. Two weeks... maybe three. Rachel reacts with dismay. Rachel moves after David towar the living room. The camera continues after her.
We work four shifts guarding him. We feed him at the end of each shift. We never leave him alone.
(turns to Rachel, hard)
And you're compromised. You don't leave the fucking house.

We can do this. We just need to stay focussed. The three turn to stare at something off-screen. The camera continues into the room to find Vogel's body slumped on the floor, bound to the radiator, mouth taped, slumped, unconscious. We continue towards him...closing on his face...CLOSER...Then his eyes open and he looks at us...
Rachel's EYES OPEN and she lies in bed listening to the muffled sound of Vogel CURSING and YELLING in German next door - a breakfast ritual that has been going on for days
(In German)

.....Fucking assholes! Fucking pig shit food! Fuck you! Fuck you! Fuck... David and Stephan are wrestling with an enraged Vogel, trying to feed him. A BOWL clatters to the floor. Vogel's shouts are muffled his mouth is taped again.

head_text.subj: FINAL SHOOTING SCRIPT WITH PINK AMENDMENTS

text: He continues to swear at his captors as best he can throu his gag. Rachel tries to block out the sound with her blanket.
Rachel walks in and finds a flushed David wiping oatmeal off his trousers, the empty bowl on the bench beside him.
(Off her look)
At this rate he's going to starve himself to death before we can get him back.

Rachel sits in the armchair near the end of her shift, watching Vogel who is slumped asleep. He looks dishevelle the oatmeal he refused to eat smeared down his chin. She can't delay the moment anymore. She takes a bowl of prepared oatmeal from the table besid her and walks towards Vogel, stirring the bowl with an unsteady hand. She kneels down in front of him. In the silence, we hear rain falling heavily outside. Vogel wakes, stays slumped, staring at her with dull eyes She takes the napkin that was covering the bowl and wipes the food from his chin. Finally she removes the tape from his mouth. Vogel watches her without moving. She offers h a spoon of oatmeal, waiting for the sudden yelling and abuse. He says nothing, just opens his mouth obediently. Rachel feeds him a spoonful of oatmeal. He speaks to Rach in German, subtitled.
My wife. Rachel ignores him, feeds him another spoonful.
Is she hurt? Another spoonful, and another.

head_text.subj: FINAL SHOOTING SCRIPT WITH PINK AMENDMENTS

text: Is she alright? An ALARM CLOCK on the table, rings - the end of her shift She wipes his mouth, tears some tape from the roll. Vogel closes his eyes, a look of such genuine suffering it stop Rachel.

Please? Tell me she's alright. Rachel puts the tape over his mouth and stands. David wal in and takes his place in the ARMCHAIR facing Vogel. Rachel begins to leave. She looks back at Vogel who is staring after her, eyes pleading. She hesitates then give a small nod and turns to walk out of the room, passing Stephan who has been standing in the doorway, watching he
Rachel starts to wash the oatmeal bowl. Stephan follows h in.
You can't talk to him.
I didn't say anything.
You can't listen to him.
I know. I just...
(overlapping)
I'm not angry - He rubs her back. Rachel stiffens a little.
- I'm just telling you - we don't talk to him. We don't listen to him. He isn't there. He isn't a human being. He... He stops himself.
We have a date. Ten days time. The Americans are going to help. Rachel looks at him, relieved.

head_text.subj: FINAL SHOOTING SCRIPT WITH PINK AMENDMENTS

text: Good. He smiles, stares at her, moves a little closer but Rache has already side-stepped him and walked away.
Stephan sits on the armchair in front of Vogel, taking th GUN apart, cleaning it.
Vogel thrashes around on the floor as best he can, David holding him down. Stephan tries to force oatmeal into him He spits it back out.
Rachel is cleaning, trying to keep busy, trying to keep t encroaching decay of the kitchen at bay, scrubbing and scrubbing.

An exhausted David, finishing his shift, walks out of the living room as Stephan walks out of his bedroom to take h place. Rachel walks out of the bathroom and into her bedroom, fo a moment the three criss-crossing each other's paths. Rachel's bedroom door closes. Both men avoid looking at each other as they pass it.
Stephan and David are carrying a struggling, cursing Voge towards the bathroom. Before they can get there Vogel pisses himself, the urine puddling on the floor at their feet.
Fuck! Stephan drops Vogel in disgust jumping back out of the wa Vogel lies in the pool, staring up at him, eyes triumphan

head_text.subj: FINAL SHOOTING SCRIPT WITH PINK AMENDMENTS

text: Vogel leans against the wall, staring blankly at the window, sunk into a profound depression. He looks filthy, jaw dark with beard growth. Rachel watches him from the doorway.

Rachel is washing Vogel's face with a towel. He pays no attention, continuing to stare out of the window. Rachel picks up a bowl of shaving cream, strips the tape off VOGEL's mouth, and begins to brush the cream over his face. She produces a RAZOR and carefully begins to shave his cheeks. She stops suddenly, a TEAR is running down Vogel's cheek, cutting a line through the soap. He turns his eyes to her
Why don't you just kill me now? Rachel pauses for a moment.
How can you keep me waiting to die like this! Rachel keeps on shaving.

I know what you want. You want to hand me over to the others, let there be some fucking sham of a trial. Then, when they kill me, you can tell yourself that there was no blood on your hands. Rachel switches to the other cheek. Vogel's getting more animated, tears in his eyes, a kind of bizarre indignation...
But that isn't true. There will be blood on your hands.

head_text.subj: FINAL SHOOTING SCRIPT WITH PINK AMENDMENTS

text: You will be my murderer! You fucking hypocrite. You fucking... Rachel tilts his chin up a little and puts the razor to h throat. He falls silent, tenses, waiting. Then...
(Softly)

Yes. Do it. You want to do it... Rachel finishes with a trembling hand. Vogel slumps back against the wall, the tension in his bo easing away. He gives her a long, calculating look. And as we watch some CHANGE seems to come over him, some new fire beginning to kindle in him - a sense of cold contempt for Rachel and with it, perhaps, a fresh determination to survive this.
That's right. I'd forgotten. You Jews never knew how to kill. Only how to die. Rachel wipes the razor clean on the towel, SLAPS fresh ta onto Vogel's mouth and gets up.

Rachel is cleaning the kitchen again, clearing some of th mess of dishes into the sink. She moves a dirty pan which has been left overnight and stops, staring at the COCKROACH which is crawling inside. A sudden wave of NAUSEA hits her.

Rachel crouches at the toilet, vomiting. She finishes, rinses her mouth, looks at her pale reflection. She opens the door and steps out... Vogel stands DIRECTLY IN FRONT OF HER. Rachel stands frozen - a split second of total panic. Then Stephan steps into sight behind Vogel, gun in hand - the morning bathroom visit.

head_text.subj: FINAL SHOOTING SCRIPT WITH PINK AMENDMENTS

text: Rachel flattens herself against the hall wall, quickly wiping her mouth dry, as Stephan pushes Vogel past her towards the bathroom.
Stephan is walking back home. A POLICE CAR SIREN wails somewhere nearby and Stephan hurriedly cuts into an alley waiting in the shadows until the siren has faded away. Th he hurries on his way.
Rachel uncovers the dish of prepared oatmeal and kneels down beside a sleeping Vogel. She removes the tape. Vogel wakes, breathes out, watches her. After a moment...
I was dreaming about my wife. She feeds him some more.
One of the great regrets of my life is that we were unable to have children. My wife would have made a wonderful mother. Vogel watches her, then suddenly SPEAKS IN ENGLISH...
It's a great blessing. Rachel stares at him.
You should try lemons. For the morning sickness. Rachel can't move.
They say it helps. Rachel struggles to hold it together, feeds him another spoonful.
What's your name? (Beat) Sarah? Hannah?...Rachel? Esther? (Beat) You Jews stay close to your roots, don't you? It's a good thing. Very good.

head_text.subj: FINAL SHOOTING SCRIPT WITH PINK AMENDMENTS

text: Rachel spoons in another mouthful.
I loved the bible as a child. Retribution. Higher justice. Rachel shovels in another mouthful. He chews it thoughtfully, examines her face.

Yes. I understand you perfectly. (Beat) You weren't lying at the clinic when you told me about your mother were you? About her death? Rachel loads the spoon with more oatmeal, determined not show any emotion.
I'm very sorry for your loss. It almost takes her breath away. She tears the tape and puts it over his mouth, gets up and walks away, determine not to show him any emotion. Vogel watches her go.
Rachel makes it out into the hallway before she feels the tears running down her face. She gives in to them, turns and finds David behind her.
What happened? What's the matter? She can't speak at first.
Nothing. He...nothing. She wipes her face.
He can understand us.
What?
He can understand every word we're saying. He just spoke to me.

head_text.subj: FINAL SHOOTING SCRIPT WITH PINK AMENDMENTS

text: Her face contorts as she tries to compose herself. David reaches out to hold her. DAVID
It's alright. It's alright. It's nearly over. He pulls her close, holds her, rests his forehead against hers. They stand like that, eyes closed. The moment hangs RACHEL

(Suddenly) Why didn't you go? At the station. You could have got away. Why didn't you? She looks up at him. He stares into her eyes. Beat. Then, suddenly he kisses her. It's what she's waited so long fo and she's stunned for a moment, then puts her arms around his neck, returning the kiss hungrily. They are helpless with desire for one another. There is a sudden scratch of a key at the front door and, instinctively, the two break apart. Stephan enters, hair wet from the rain. He stops, seeing them, sensing the atmosphere. They stare back at him. Rachel steps away a little, wiping her face. RACHEL (CONT'D)
What did they say? Stephan stares at them in silence. He unbuttons his coat. DAVID
Stephan? STEPHAN
It's not happening. They stare at him aghast - this is the last thing they wanted to hear. DAVID
What the fuck does that mean? STEPHAN
The Americans have pulled out. (To Rachel) Has he been fed? DAVID
So...so what does that mean? RACHEL
Oh God...

head_text.subj: FINAL SHOOTING SCRIPT WITH PINK AMENDMENTS

text: STEPHAN
Did you feed him? DAVID
What does that mean? What's the plan now? RACHEL
(rising panic) We just need to get him to the airfield, there must be some other way, some... Stephan starts down the hallway towards her, angry. STEPHAN
I said has he...? David instinctively steps in front of Rachel, raises a hand. DAVID
(overlapping) I'm asking you... STEPHAN

(overlapping) I'm talking to her! Supposedly it's her shift now, but instead of doing what she's supposed to be doing she's out here with you! (To Rachel) Now answer the fucking question: Did you feed him? RACHEL
YES! I fed him! Stephan stands glaring at her, then turns abruptly away. STEPHAN
(Beat) There's no plan. There's no fucking plan. They said the operation is being "re- evaluated." He turns to David. STEPHAN
You know what that means? They're going to cut us loose. They stare at him shocked.

head_text.subj: FINAL SHOOTING SCRIPT WITH PINK AMENDMENTS

text: STEPHAN
It's a fucking mess and they're backing away from it quickly as they can.
(Beat) No. STEPHAN
It's happening. I can feel it. RACHEL
They can't just leave us! STEPHAN
Yes they can! Because we fucked it all up! We fucked it all up and now we're on our own! Suddenly we hear someone KNOCKING on the front door. The three FREEZE, staring at each other. Silence. DAVID
Were you followed? Stephan stares at the door, thrown. DAVID (CONT'D)
Could you have been...? There is another KNOCK at the door. Stephan turns to the chest of drawers and takes out the GUN.
Stephan? Stephan is hurriedly screwing the SILENCER onto the GUN. There's another KNOCK at the door.
Stephan! Stephan walks into the living room and aims the gun at Vogel. Vogel instinctively squirms away, falling to one side, wriggling back as far as he can. RACHEL (CONT'D)
What are you doing? STEPHAN
If it's them, he dies. Vogel lies, breathing hard through his nose, eyes on the gun aimed at him.

head_text.subj: FINAL SHOOTING SCRIPT WITH PINK AMENDMENTS

text: David suddenly steps in between the two, the gun now pointing at his chest. STEPHAN (CONT'D)
Move. DAVID
You're not doing this. STEPHAN
He's not getting away from me. DAVID
This isn't the mission. STEPHAN
I decide what the mission is! If I say he dies, he dies. DAVID
We're finishing this mission. We're taking him back. STEPHAN

Get out of the way! There is another KNOCK at the door. David and Stephan sta at each other, the tension building. Abruptly Rachel turn and walks down the hallway towards the door. Stephan call after her. STEPHAN

Rachel. Rachel! From the hallway we hear the sound of the door being open - the murmur of conversation. The two men stand frozen, listening. Vogel lies, breathin hard through his nose. We hear the door close. The three listen as footsteps approach down the hall... Rachel walks back in. A long beat. RACHEL
(Dully) It was the lady from the bottom apartment. She invited us to her New Year's Eve party. She turns and walks back out. The others stay where they are, frozen. We hear a PIANO PLAYING as we...

head_text.subj: FINAL SHOOTING SCRIPT WITH PINK AMENDMENTS

text: As the piano music plays we see David and Stephan practis krav magah moves - careful, controlled, but under it all edge of real tension between them.
Vogel is tied in his usual place. Stephan sits in a dangerous mood. He's playing the piano. A lyrical renderi of Deutschland Uber Alles. Vogel is watching him.

As the music continues the two men's workout grows more intense - the punches and blocks build in speed, faster a faster, both men breathing hard with the exertion, neithe willing to stop, a real violence simmering under the surface.
Stephan knows he's watched and avoids Vogel's gaze until can stand it no longer and looks...
David is the first to break through the blocks - his fist stopping inches from Stephen's face. The two men freeze, staring at each other, breathing hard. The music crashes a halt.

Stephan is staring at Vogel. He begins to play the anthem more discordantly, hitting the keys more violently, as if the music is possessing him. Then suddenly he stops, stands up and walks away from the keyboard. Stares at Vogel. Vogel is very aware of the sudden change in atmosphere, a sense of impending violence. Stephan doesn't move. The moment hangs.
David is taking over the shift from Stephan. They pass ea other in the doorway without a word.

head_text.subj: FINAL SHOOTING SCRIPT WITH PINK AMENDMENTS

text: David stops, staring... Vogel lies in his usual place. A SACK has been placed ove his head, hooding him. The effect is deeply sinister.
Stephan sits eating with Rachel. David walks in and throw the SACK on the table. Stephan glances at it, continues eating.
What are you doing?
It's your shift.
(To Rachel)
Did you know about this?
About what?
(To Stephan)
His mouth's taped. You want him to suffocate?
I was sick of seeing his face. Go back in.
Don't do that again. Stephan gets up and walks calmly towards David as if shooing him back out the room.

You don't give orders David. It's your shift now so you can go back in there... He has his hands on David's chest, gently pushing him bac David takes his hold of the hands, pulling them free and suddenly there's a flurry of violent movement as Stephan yanks his arms free of David and the two men shove at eac other.
Stop it! They stop, breathing hard.

head_text.subj: FINAL SHOOTING SCRIPT WITH PINK AMENDMENTS

text: We're not animals. Just remember what we are. Remember what we're not. He walks back out. Stephan sits back at the table, starts eating again. He glances at Rachel, but she won't look at him. After a moment she gets up and walks out.
David looks up from his chair to see in the hallway. Something purposeful in her manner alerts him.
David appears in time to see Rachel is putting on her overcoat.
What are you doing? Rachel doesn't look at him.
I have to get out.
(Gently)
Rachel... Rachel tries to unbolt the door. David bars her. Rachel tries to talk calmly but she's fighting panic.
Get out of my way, please. I'm just going to go out for a few minutes. That's all I want to do. Stephan walks out of the kitchen, taking in the scene.
She wants to go out.
(appealing)
No one will see me. Tell him, David. I just want to walk. I just want to get some...air. Please. Stephan shakes his head.

head_text.subj: FINAL SHOOTING SCRIPT WITH PINK AMENDMENTS

text: Rachel tries to unlock the door, but David has hold of it She struggles against him.
Don't be stupid. He takes her arm. Rachel jerks free.

Then she slumps against the door, her back to them. She's crying brokenly. A beat as the two men stand over her, not attempting to comfort her any further. Stephan turns and walks away. David leans his head against the door, waiting for her to stop. 160    INT. SAFEHOUSE - LIVING ROOM. EVENING. It's raining heavily outside and water is dripping throug the cracks in the ceiling. David kneels next to VOGEL with a bowl of oatmeal and strips the tape from his mouth.
Thank you. David. David doesn't react. Vogel hums a tune to himself in between spoonfuls, watchi David, his mood strange.
David and Stephan and Rachel... He gives a soft laugh, finding something amusing in the sound of the names.
